alert.note: Alert for Ouachita (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 30 at 8:08PM CDT until April 30 at 10:05PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Ouachita County in southwestern Arkansas... * Until 1005 PM CDT. * At 808 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Radar was estimating between two and three inches of rain have fallen in the last several hours. Additional heavy rainfall is likely over the next hour or two. Flash flooding is likely ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Stephens, Louann, Buena Vista, Elliot, Kirkland and Frenchport. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
